content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

To create the `clean_column` function in Julia, follow this example:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col_lower = lowercase(col)

    # Strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col_stripped = strip(col_lower)

    # Replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col_cleaned = replace(replace(col_stripped, r"\s" => "_"), r"\-" => "_"))

    return col_cleaned
end
```

Now you have a function `clean_column` that takes a column name as input and returns the cleaned version of the column name.
